Minds built to go the distance

In understanding why Kenyans dominate the Boston Marathon, the most important factors may be the marathoner’s brain, and their concept of distance.

Mass. faulted on abuse reporting

In a nationwide survey, Massachusetts received only a C grade for effectiveness in reporting deaths and near-fatal injuries of children from abuse and neglect.

iRobot turns attention to consumers

Anticipating that its business with the US military will decline sharply, iRobot Crop. is launching a $10 million advertising campaign targeting consumers.
opinion | Kevin Cullen

Ziff grew up poor in Holyoke and got rich reading. Not rich in a monetary sense, but in the sense of learning.

Historic Boston walking tour
